name: retain
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to keep or continue to have something

example.eg: She has lost her battle to retain control of the company.
example.egtrans: 她被打败了，失去了继续掌管公司的权力。

example.eg: He managed to retain his dignity throughout the performance.
example.egtrans: 在整个表演过程中，他设法保持了自己的尊严。

example.eg: She succeeded in retaining her lead in the second half of the race.
example.egtrans: 在比赛的后半程中，她成功地保住了领先地位。

example.eg: I have a good memory and am able to retain (= remember) facts easily.
example.egtrans: 我记忆力很好，记东西不费劲。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a substance retains something, such as heat or water, it continues to hold or contain it.

example.eg: The sea retains the sun's warmth longer than the land.
example.egtrans: 海水储存太阳的热量的时间比陆地要长。

trans_examp.trans_en: to get the services of a lawyer by paying them before you need them
